intro: Parameria philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine parameria, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland areas and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It has a woody stem and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
